definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: The roc flew so high that I couldn't see the earth below me.
sentences.chinese: 大鹏鸟飞得很高，根本看不到底下地面的情形。

sentences.english: I untied the turban from the bird's foot.
sentences.chinese: 于是便把头巾从大鹏鸟的脚上解了下来。

sentences.english: As soon as I had done this, the bird jumped on a large snake.
sentences.chinese: 我一解下头巾，大鹏鸟一跃扑向一条大蛇。

definition: kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
three-legged Golden Crow that lives in the sun (in northeast Asian and Chinese mythology)/Korean: samjog'o
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
(bird species of China) golden eagle (Aquila chrysaetos)
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
a water goblin in Chinese mythology usually depicted as a monkey
Golden Crow/the sun/the three-legged golden crow that lives in the sun
